decks.notes: This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategies through counterspells, removal, and targeted discard spells while generating card advantage through card draw and recursion. The deck also utilizes powerful artifacts such as Black Lotus and Moxen for ramp and efficiency. The goal is to control the game, protect important threats like Snapcaster Mage, and eventually win through incremental advantage or combo finishers. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds additional recursion and value to the deck.

The key strategy of this deck is to utilize various card draw spells and tutors to quickly assemble the combo pieces needed for a Doomsday win condition. By efficiently digging through the deck and selecting the right cards with Doomsday, the player can set up a winning pile that includes Thassa's Oracle to win the game on the spot. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Force of Will and Duress to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's game plan. With fast mana acceleration and efficient card selection, this deck aims to win the game in a single explosive turn.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of countermagic, removal, and card advantage. It utilizes cards like Force of Will, Spell Pierce, and Fatal Push to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining card advantage with spells like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time. The deck also includes disruptive creatures like Orcish Bowmasters and Psychic Frog to slow down the opponent's tempo. The key strategy revolves around resource management and efficiently answering threats while setting up win conditions through card advantage and incremental advantage.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy by using hate cards like Archon of Emeria, Chancellor of the Annex, and Void Mirror while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Clarion Conqueror and White Plume Adventurer. It aims to control the game by denying resources with cards like Wasteland and Strip Mine, while also having the potential for explosive starts with fast mana like Black Lotus and the Moxen. The deck's goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan and quickly close out the game with efficient threats.

This deck aims to control the game by using powerful counterspells and card advantage to shut down the opponent's threats. It also includes various tutors to search for key cards and ways to generate extra mana. The presence of Hullbreacher and LÃ³rien Revealed helps to disrupt the opponent's card draw and resources. The deck includes a Time Vault combo for a potential win condition, along with other powerful cards like Tinker and Yawgmoth's Will. Overall, the strategy revolves around efficiently controlling the game and setting up for a game-winning play.

The main focus of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan, control the board with countermagic and removal spells, and generate card advantage through efficient draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time. Lurrus of the Dream-Den serves as a powerful companion that can provide recurring value and resilience. The deck also utilizes disruptive elements like Null Rod and Wasteland to hinder the opponent's resources, while Orcish Bowmasters and Psychic Frog offer versatile creature-based control options. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent in a long game.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful control spells and disruptive elements to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent. By efficiently managing resources and disrupting the opponent's game plan, the deck aims to control the pace of the game and ultimately secure victory. With a mix of card draw, counter spells, removal, and mana denial, the deck is designed to adapt to various situations and strategically navigate the game to secure a win.

The deck focuses on generating mana quickly and efficiently using artifact mana sources like Black Lotus, Moxen, and Mana Crypt, and then utilizing cards like Paradoxical Outcome and Tolarian Academy to draw a large number of cards and generate even more mana. The deck also includes counterspells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect its combo pieces, as well as disruption like Swords to Plowshares and Thoughtseize. The companion Lurrus of the Dream-Den provides additional recursion for key pieces, ensuring that the deck can continue to execute its game plan even if disrupted.

The deck focuses on using efficient counterspells and removal spells to control the opponent's board while drawing cards and setting up powerful spells. It also utilizes key cards like Ancestral Recall and Demonic Tutor to find answers or threats as needed. The addition of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional card advantage and recursion. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan, generate card advantage, and eventually win the game through powerful spells and efficient threats.

The main focus of this Dimir Control deck is to efficiently control the game through the use of counterspells, removal, and card advantage. Utilizing powerful cards such as Force of Will, Mana Drain, and Ancestral Recall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while gaining card advantage with cards like Dig Through Time and Treasure Cruise. With a strong mana base and access to powerful planeswalkers like LÃ³rien Revealed and Wan Shi Tong, Librarian, the deck seeks to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent in order to secure victory.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with hatebear creatures while applying pressure through aggressive attacks. It utilizes cards like Archon of Emeria and Chancellor of the Annex to slow down the opponent's spells, paired with Anointed Peacekeeper to keep the board under control. The deck also includes hate cards like Void Mirror to disrupt non-creature spells. The mana base is designed to support the aggressive strategy with Ancient Tomb and fast mana sources like Moxen, while also providing protection with Cavern of Souls.

This deck focuses on using the card Doomsday to stack the top of the library in a specific order to win the game. The deck includes various card draw spells, counterspells, and tutors to set up the combo quickly and efficiently. With the right sequencing and timing, the deck aims to manipulate the game state to create a winning situation with Thassa's Oracle or other win conditions. The goal is to quickly assemble the combo and win the game before the opponent has a chance to respond effectively.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive artifact creatures and disruptive cards like Sphere of Resistance and Thorn of Amethyst. By utilizing mana acceleration from cards like Ancient Tomb and Mishra's Workshop, the deck aims to establish an early advantage and lock down the opponent's resources with cards like Trinisphere and Crucible of Worlds. The deck also has access to powerful threats like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Wurmcoil Engine to close out the game efficiently. Additionally, the deck has some utility lands like Karakas and Bojuka Bog to handle specific threats from the opponent.

The deck focuses on using control elements, counterspells, disruption, and card advantage to out-value and out-tempo the opponent. It leverages powerful Vintage restricted cards like Ancestral Recall, Time Walk, and Tutors to generate card advantage and set up game-winning plays. The deck also includes disruption elements like Wasteland and Strip Mine to disrupt the opponent's mana base, as well as removal spells like Fatal Push to deal with threats. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value and recursion options for the deck.

The focus of this deck is to assemble the combo pieces needed to execute a game-winning Doomsday play. Utilizing powerful card draw and manipulation spells, along with fast mana acceleration, the deck aims to quickly stack the top of the library with the necessary cards to win the game with Thassa's Oracle. With a mix of counterspells for protection and efficient tutors to find key pieces, the deck is designed to execute its game plan with precision and speed in the Vintage 1 vs 1 format.

This UW Control deck focuses on using powerful counterspells, efficient removal, card advantage, and disruption to control the game. The deck also includes a wide range of powerful Vintage restricted cards such as Black Lotus, Ancestral Recall, and Time Walk to gain a significant advantage. The inclusion of cards like Lurrus of the Dream-Den and Urza's Saga add extra value and utility to the deck, making it a formidable force in Vintage 1 vs 1 matchups.
